page.title: 14BISHOP BURTON CHARITY WEEK
page.content: The students of Bishop Burton College of Agriculture, through their Student Union and Rag Committee, organise during the academic year activities and entertainments to raise money for national charities of their choice. The events are concentrated during {'Rag Week', usually the first week in {May.}There are certain traditional activities; A{Bed Push}which involves pushing 'home-made beds' from the College to Beverley and back, collecting money en route. A{Fun Run}which is a cross-country run set within the College grounds. It attempts to keep up an image of fit farmers! A{Parade of floats}built by students and towed through Beverley. This year the charity given Â£1000 was Guide dogs for the Blind.
